TopicTitle: The changing face of Squad and KSP

Articles.Content:
KSP is a maturing game, in a month or so it will be 3 years old, two of those years have been available to the public. It has been six months since the forum blackout and when Damion left the community, now I know that in all that time is expected that people will come and go like Moderators and Devs but I have a recently noticed that there has been some people coming and going without any official annocment from Squad to the community. Novasilisko's account got downgraded to a normal account for many months and just recently Captain Skunky's account got downgraded, all without any annocment. On top of that there are many new faces on the development team as well as the moderation team.

Would be kind of nice to know who we should appreciate for making this great game.

Squad doesn't usually make detailed announcements regarding changes in staff, because they respect the privacy of their employees. I might make a post about the organisation of the moderation team soon but to my knowledge no-one has been fired from it, though some people left due to various reasons (again, privacy) often leading to them not having the time to moderate anymore or losing interest in moderating. In the case of Nova an announcement was indeed made in HarvesteR's blog post about the developer team. His status is that of developer on leave.

*cough* ClairaLyrae *cough*

Hey guys, we've had a few changes in the roster as of late. It is company policy and professional courtesy to not disclose this sort of things. The entire active team Squad team will be coming to the Mexico City HQ for Kerbalkon, but the About page on our site is currently accurate on who is and isn't involved in the project. On the particular circumstance of Claira, she is a remarkably helpful part of the team, but her actual working time is limited due to her obligations as a student.
I hope the weekly Kerbal update comes back. I found that great and useful, etc.

I think thats a very fair point. Its hard to understand that we're not a big club. Squad is a business and we are its customers. I feel very well-treated by Squad and still enjoy my time (read: hours) on the KSP forums, despite the changes.
